H625.def: = act of bringing in crops from the field at the time of harvest

H7019.def: = hot season of the year, opposite of {L:חֹרֶף<SDBH:חֹרֶף>}; ► time when most crops are harvested and preparations are made for the cold season; ≈ sometimes associated with excessive heat and drought, and also with hard work

H5955.def: = crops that are left on the field after the harvest, ≈ sometimes used figuratively to denote the aftermath of an event

H1210.def: = pattern of actions by which humans harvest the grapes that have matured and are ready for picking

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H811.def: = group of flowers or fruits positioned on one stem

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H1063.def: = fruit of the {L:fig<SDBH:תְּאֵנָה>} tree, of the variety that ripens early (in June); ► appreciated because of their fine flavor

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H183.def: = state in which humans sense a physical craving for food or alcoholic drinks; this desire is associated with one's {L:נֶפֶשׁ<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>} ≈ and can be both good and evil

H2623.def: = someone who practices חֶסֶד, who is committed towards fulfilling his/her obligations; these may be obligations defined within the context of a covenant or agreement, or moral obligations to do well to someone who did well to you before

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H693.def: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H2764.def: = long net hanging vertically in the water with floats at the upper edge and weights at the lower edge; ► drawn in by men working in boats or from shore; as the ends are drawn together to the boat or drawn ashore, fish are trapped in the area enclosed by the net; drawn in immediately after it has been spread out; ≈ associated with aggression and control

36.gl: a man ... his brother > one ... each other

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H3190.def: = causative action by which humans cause objects to be in a better state of maintenance than before

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H1942.def: = state of experiencing an urge to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ usually evil

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H5686.def: exact meaning unsure; literally: to weave; possibly: = action by which humans create an elaborate scheme by integrating different components into a single master plan

H2312.def: = plant with thorns; ≈ regarded as useless; symbol of hardship

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H4534.def: = a hedge of thorns, thistles, briers; ≈ regarded as useless

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6822.def: = action by which humans or deities watch attentitvely to monitor people and places

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H3998.def: = state in which humans are so much affected by certain circumstances that they do not know what to do

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H441.def: = person in a position of leadership over a tribe or clan

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H6607.def: literally: opening up of words; hence: = causative process by which deities make words easier to understand

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H2436.def: = front of the body of a human being, which, when a person is sitting down, forms a kind of platform that can be used for activities like throwing the lot, and that can even function as a sitting place for someone else, like a pet animal, a child or a beloved one; ≈ symbolizes affection and intimacy, and sometimes represents the entire person

H5034.def: = process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H6822.def: = action by which humans or deities watch attentitvely to monitor people and places

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3176.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3468.def: = a state in which a human or deity helps a human in need to be safe / a safe state

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H2197.def: = state in which humans are exceedingly angry to the extent that it is visible in their appearance

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7378.def: = action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H955.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H335.def: = referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H4823.def: = action by which humans or animals tread heavily and noisily on people, plants, or objects; ► usually with the purpose of killing, destroying, desecrating, and/or humiliating

H2916.def: = wet soil;◄ moistened by rain or because of its proximity to a body of water; ► can be used for pottery or bricks; ≈ regarded as cheap, easily obtainable and workable material for making basic items; otherwise as a valueless substance or an obstacle for movement

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H1447.def: = a continuous vertical structure, usually made of natural stones, that encloses or divides an area of land; ≈ associated with security; in some cases used figuratively to denote integrity, which can be negatively affected by sin

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H2706.def: = specific actions required by somebody in authority

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H804.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as founder of Assyria

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H4693.def: = state of severe sorrow or anguish

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants

H4611.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H910.def: = the state of being apart from significant others

H3293.def: = a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals

H3759.def: = newly ripened grain which has just been harvested and which has not yet been dried for storage or for grinding into flour

H1316.def: = region; ◄ north-east of the River {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}, ► at one time ruled by king {L:Og<SDBH:עֹוג>}, later assigned to half of the tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}

H1568.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Makir<SDBH:מָכִיר>}; tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}; ► settler of the area on the east side of the {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H6381.def: = state in which an event is out of the ordinary, inspiring amazement, and usually associated with the supernatural

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H1369.def: = the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H2790.def: = causative action by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool

H3897.def: = action by which animals ingest food with the help of their tongue

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H5175.def: = long legless reptile without eyelids or external ears; it moves by wriggling or gliding; some species have a poisonous bite; ≈ symbol of lurking, unexpected danger; associated with lies, deception, and misleading teaching

H2119.def: = action by which a limbless animal moves itself forward on its belly

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7264.def: = process by which humans or objects shake involuntarily; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions

H4526.def: = a flat, rectangular piece of metal, attached to the sides of an object, ► usually for decoration purposes

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6342.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of strong emotions of joy, awe, or fear

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

30.gl: to turn in terror to (someone else)

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H5703.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H2655.def: = state in which humans are emotionally attached to deities

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H7355.def: = state in which humans feel affection for others

H3533.def: literally: to be trodden underfoot; hence: = state in which land has come under someone's authority or control, usually after having been conquered with force

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H4688.def: = a very low area of the earth

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H85.def: = man, also known as {L:Abram<SDBH:אַבְרָם>}; ◄ son of {L:Terah<SDBH:תֶּרַח>}; ► first patriarch of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; father of {L:Ishmael<SDBH:יִשְׁמָעֵאל>} and {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark
